headline: Easy Pumpkin Muffins
description: Enjoy this easy pumpkin muffin recipe for great tasting treats that feel like fall. A delicious and comforting snack, these muffins are always a hit.

video.description: These muffins are moist and tasty, and freeze well.
video.name: Easy Pumpkin Muffins

name: Easy Pumpkin Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper liners.
Mix together cake mix, pumpkin puree, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves in a large bowl until smooth. Spoon equal amounts of batter into the prepared muffin cups.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of one comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I used white cake mix, because it was what I had, and two teaspoons pumpkin pie spice, again what I had. My kids and niece and nephew love them!! And honestly, these were such a relief to find. I had made some blueberry muffins, and everyone but me liked them. I'm 35 weeks pregnant with my fourth, full time teacher and have three other five and under. I am exhausted and was out of vanilla and a few other things. This recipe made my day. Thank you! One bowl pumpkin muffins for the win! Oh and I added a scoop of unflavored vegan protein powder, because I felt guilty making so many muffins. Lol
Excellent recipe! I added 1 /4 cup of finely chopped pecans. Do not add egg or oil. The batter is stiff but the muffins are moist and delicious!
I added 1 tbsp oil and 1 egg.
I used a gluten free Krusteaz cinnamon swirl cake and muffin mix. Added two eggs, and cooked on 375 for about 15 minutes. Perfect and delicious! (I mixed the topping ingredients in with the batter.)
I made the large muffin pan for these. A meal in a muffin! We loved these. Moist, and not an overpowering pumpkin flavor. Will be making them more often than just for the holidays.
This is a simple delicious recipe to teach kids how to bake. Used it with my goddaughter to teach her. It was so moist and flavorful with all the fall pumpkin flavors.
13+ minutes at same temp for mini muffins. I added 1/4 cup milk. Try without added liquid next time based on comments.
Ooooooo mmmmm
It turned out really well. I also thought it tasted really delicious.
Easy recipe! Delicious ! I made a crumb topping with butter, brown sugar, flour and cinnamon !!!

The muffins/cupcakes turned out fine. I used more purée than called for to enhance the flavour. For my taste they were far too sweet, an outcome of using a cake mix. Very easy and a handy treat for kids.
Just OK is right. Easy enough even if you tweak it a bit . Doughy is the best description I have. Not saying I wouldn't try again in a pinch.

I’ve made this with Devils Food Cake Mix also. I added chocolate chips, it is a very moist and healthier chocolate muffin. Have made with and without egg and water; both ways worked well. The dough is thick and stiff and egg/water makes the dough easier to spoon into themuffin cups.
This could not be easier and the results are worth the minimal effort. Perfect for quick breakfast for kids on the go.
I found them too dense. Flavor was ok tho.
I didn't change a thing and I will make again. Very moist.

As the oldest of 13 I have a lot of NIeces and few Nephews that want to learn to cook with me (been cooking 40+years), this is simple and easy enough for the youngest 7 years old, that I dont have to worry about huge messes. I changed the spices to 1 Tablespoon in a double batch and made them in a mini-muffin pan. baked them for 15 minutes and they turned out wonderfully.
These muffins are very moist. I was a half a cup short on pumpkin so I added half a cup of applesauce. I also added some mini chocolate chips. I will certainly make these again.
Yes add milk
Easy to make and taste so moist and good!
Can’t complain about the taste, followed the recipe and they’re delicious! They are definitely pumpkin cupcakes though - very sweet, I had to bake for a little longer than 25 min.

I made exactly as written. I love the texture and they are really moist. I'm just not loving the flavor. I used a yellow cake mix so next time definitely will try another flavor such as chocolate. Easiest recipe ever!
This was great, made a crumble and sprinkled on the top, hubby loved them..
I used Moist Spice cake mix and added a few Tbsp of olive oil. Made a dozen mini and 5 regular size muffins. Super easy
I forgot the spices and made with the cake mix and pumpkin purée which turned out great! Yummy!

My older daughter has declared these muffins to be her new favorite! I found out about this recipe at my WW meeting. Depending on the brand of cake mix used, this is (with the current WW plan) only 2-3 points per muffin! At my meeting, it was recommended to use a spice cake mix and pumkin - no other ingredients needed. I used yellow cake mix as recommended here and 1.5 tsp of pumpkin spice blend. The batter is very thick, but that's totally FINE. It bakes up nicely and makes lovely, moist muffins. Thanks for posting this recipe!
I only made 4 muffins and 12 donuts they came out fabulous!
Delicious, super moist but I did add a little oil.

We made these tonight exactly as recipe read with yellow cake mix. We iced half with cream cheese frosting and kept the others without frosting. We really loved them plain. They tasted just like pumpkin pie. They were so good! I might try them the next time with spice cake mix, but can’t imagine them any better.

This is a great starter recipe. To create a less dense muffin I added 1/4 c. melted butter, 2/3 c. milk, and doubled the spices for flavor. Then I mixed with a blender until well blended about 2 minutes. I folded in 1 c. mini chocolate chips. This made 18 delicious muffins.
added 2 eggs and 1/3 cup oil double the spices came out great made 9 jumbo muffins

Perfect just the way they are! Even my finicky son loves them and they store or freeze well. Trust in the recipe you will not be sorry. I keep yellow cake mix and pumpkin on hand just for this recipe, it's my go to muffin recipe.

Read previous reviews regarding eggs and oil and denseness of batter. I had some leftover cinnamon applesauce in the fridge so added that to the batter. Easy to do and loosened the batter a little. Made more than a dozen muffins with the added ingredient. For ease I would make them again, flavor was good but a little too cakey for muffins. If you're not much of a baker, could use 2 tsp. pumpkin spice mix rather than all the spices.

Very tasty. Not my favorite recipe for pumpkin muffins, but absolutely a miracle in its simplicity, and a keep er for those times when you’ve got cake mix and canned pumpkin but literally not an egg in the house. :-)
Super simple! I “helped” the grandkids make these muffins for Thanksgiving using a gluten free yellow cake mix. A keeper!
The only thing you need to add is chocolate chips and pecans, in my opinion. My kids love them!
I must have done something wrong as these didn't turn out well at all. Had to throw them out. So disappointed.
Great recipe, easy and quick, and everyone at the office loved them. Made this with a spice cake mix, as others suggested, will definitely make it this way again.

I made these with a spice cake mix...(another recipe out there),
adding 1/2 cup water and no spices. Added nuts and raisons in half of the batter. I put a cream cheese icing on some, orange for Halloween, and appropriate picks for the holiday. My local grocery store had the canned pumpkin and cake mix on sale for $1.00 each. Not bad for 24 muffins !
Yummy cupcakes, I would add some extra spices and I have to cool my 28-30mins. Thanks for the recipe
I made one bread loaf, but I ran out of bread pans. So I ended up putting some of the mixture into muffin pans; baked 12 mins. They're the best pumpkin muffins I've ever had!
Easy, delicious - perfect.
I will make it again but it really needs an egg or two added to it.

Yummy, I wanted to make mini-muffins for daycare and so I read other reviews and did make a couple changes, I used a spice cake mix for extra flavor, I also added 2 eggs and 1/2 cup oil. I realize it would have baked without but I really didn't want a super thick consistency for mini muffins. Really great recipe. Thanks!!
The batter didn't have a lot of pumpkin flavor to it. Will see how it taste when I get it out of the oven. Easy recipe though. Do like that...
These are great. I did not have cloves I used cinnamon nutmeg and ginger. I substituted spice cake mix. I topped with rum flavored buttercream.
Followed the recipe as described and used a mixer to mix the ingredients . The clover and yellow cake mix kind of over powered the pumpkin in the muffins. Food was still edible but not a favorite.
Didn't change a thing. Made for a work potluck. These got rave reviews. Couldn't have been easier. None were left and co-workers were looking for more. Thank you for submitting.
They really were yummy. Didn’t do five star only because I should’ve mixed with a mixer to get all of the mix really stirred in

I make these often. You can use ANY flavor cake mix. I use white or yellow. I always add half of a bag of mini chocolate chips, a dash of pumpkin pie spice, and a splash of milk. They are fluffier with milk in them instead of dense.

These are hands down the best muffins I've ever made. I was shocked with how beautifully they turned out! Moist yet dense and so, so tasty! I am absolutely making these again come Autumn and/or Winter. I might even experiment with different cake mix flavors, I bet chocolate would be amazing!

Five stars for the simplicity. I actually used a spice cake mix and also threw in a random amount of cinnamon, cloves and pumpkin pie spice. I put chocolate chips in and on top of half and raisins in the other half of the batter. Super delicious especially if eaten right out of the oven With butter. Definitely a keeper. Makes 12 muffins. They plump up nicely without overflowing.

This simple recipe is nearly a glorified dump cake with additional spices thrown in for delicious measure. No extra moisture is needed! Seriously. I used a devil's food chocolate cake mix, doubled the spices shown and boosted the pumpkin puree with (2) teaspoons of pumpkin pie spice. Finished off the muffins by pressing in a walnut. Devilishly (pun intended) good smells are wafting from the cooling muffins.
Quick and easy. Next time I might add pecans and raisins.
I tried making them with the white cake mix and they were good. I then made it with spice cake and they were delicious!
Substitute Spice or carrot cake mix foe even more flavor!

I just made these and this is a great and easy base recipe that can be tweaked to your liking! The main changes I made were - I used 1 T pumpkin pie spice sincere that is all I had. I think next time I will even increase that to 1.5-2 T since the spices were not the most noticeable flavors. Like others mentioned the batter was really thick and I had a bit of a hard time getting it incorporated (I was just using a spatula) so I added 1/2 cup of water and it smoothed out nicely. This added about 10 minutes to the baking time. Finally I added mini chocolate chips to the batter and sprinkled walnuts on top. I also just sprayed the muffin tin and the muffins popped right out. Again with a few tweaks this is a great easy and cheap recipe!
These muffins have a weird texture in the mouth and taste and metalic. Don't waste your ingredients!
I added a streusel topping for half of them and mini chocolate chips for the other half. All we're well received.
Delicious! Did not change a thing, and they turned out amazing - moist and tasty!

This was such a simple recipe. I used a spice cake mix and still added the spices. I served this at a Quilter's meeting and was asked for the recipe by members. Needless to say, I can't take a picture because the dozen of muffins disappeared in a New York Second.

This recipe is very good! I have made a version of this before, and I was so happy when I found it here again. The spice is perfect! I made a few changes, instead of yellow cake batter I used french vanilla, and I have heard some people use chocolate. It would be a good idea to split the batter in half and add some cocoa powder to half if you have some chocolate and some vanilla fans as we do in our house. Also, I only baked for 18 minutes and they turned out FABULOUS! Thank you for posting this, it is one of our favorite fall muffin recipes!
I added an egg because the mixture was so dry.

I used spice cake mix, don't be tempted to add eggs or anything else. Muffinbatter needs thick for moist muffin.
 I might put some cream cheese frosting on some of them !
Did not like at all the day I made them. The rest was put in freezer and was not as bad, but nothing I would offer guest.
So easy and good! I used a can of pumpkin and a box of spice cake mix!

I used a spice cake mix and added 1 and 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice. I read another review of this procedure and followed the "do not add anymore fluids" note. The batter is very thick, but there is enough moisture in it to carry off this recipe. The muffins are very tasty, very moist!

I doubled this recipe and added 2 eggs and about 1/2 cup vegetable oil. After baking and cooling I made a cream cheese glaze and drizzled on the top, then sprinkled on a few chopped walnuts... oh my goodness! Sooooo good and many asked for the recipe!
These are ridiculously easy. Hubby likes them with white cake best. I use a tablespoon of pumpkin pie mix instead of measuring out cinnamon/cloves/nutmeg. Even the picky kids beg for them!

Very dense, which was fine, but no taste. We could barely taste the pumpkin, inside was very moist, almost too much. We even cooked an extra 10 minutes because we were sure it should have been more done inside. The next morning the muffins were the same inside, but the taste was even more bland. It needs more spice for sure. Plus a brown sugar crust on the top to help bring out the flavor. Muffin paper did not peel off well.
This recipe is NOT flawed. The muffins were moist and delicious. I plan to make them again and again. Easy. Easy. Easy. Yummy. Yummy. Yummy.

I am the cook at a child care center, and I made these for the kids this week. The batter is unpleasantly stiff so I added just a touch of apple sauce to loosen things up a bit. Personally, I did not like them. They have an odd texture and are way too sweet for my taste. However, the children LOVED them. All the classroom teachers came back looking for more. So, yes! I will definitely make them again.
This is a good pumpkin muffin recipe. I added 2T. molasses and 1/2 c. applesauce, turned out very good, and made them more of a pumpkin color.
Didn't change a thing other than spices because I used mace instead of nutmeg and allspice for cloves! Amazing taste, moist and super easy. Thanks for sharing!
Not my favorite... It was dense. It was more like pumpkin play-dough than a muffin consistency.

For those who were confused, you are not making the cake batter and then adding the other ingredients. The can of pumpkin provides all the moisture! I used a spiced cake mix instead of the yellow cake mix and they turned out GREAT. I would use 1/2 a teaspoon of cinnamon though. They were very moist and taste great with a cup of coffee!!

Great base recipe!! i have made as directed and they turn out well but i usually mix it up. I add some coconut oil or applesauce to loosen up the batter a bit so it is easier to work with. great with spice cake or carrot cake. also really tasty with shredded carrots and a pecan crumb topping ;0
EASY and delicious. I used spice cake mix, my own pumpkin purée and 2 jalapeños from the garden. YUM. Will definitely make again.

OM Stars Delicious, although i did make it with spice cake mix and a little extra pumpkin pie spice ( was the cake mix i had on hand) i also added 0ne of those lil applesauce cups to the mix as well and topped with a cinnamon cream cheese icing
god I love these. BUT BEWARE: by the time I had eaten one, I had eaten all twenty four.

This recipe is AMAZING. I only did the cake mix, pumpkin and cinnamon. Add a little butter on top once they're out and it's now my favorite breakfast. I did NOT add anything that the cake mix needed. It's frustrating to mix up (especially when your KitchenAid is dirty) but it's so worth it in the end! Use an ice cream scoop for absolutely perfect muffins. Love, love, love!
Super easy and delicious! I absolutely LOVE them!

Mmmmmm these turned out yummy, I was a little skeptical at first but once I ate one it was tasty. 
They were so moist and so easy to make I made a second batch with extra pumpkin pie spice, walnuts, and craisans. Made these for the morning and they taste even better reheated the next day!

The reviews I read were good but I really wish I had read some of the negative reviews too. The batter was quick to put together, but it was very stiff and it was very difficult to get it into the muffin pan without making a mess. These muffins definitely do not look like the picture ... but I guess I should have read more reviews before making this recipe since there appears to be some tricks to getting these muffins to look more like a normal muffin and not like some strange spikey cup cakes. I lot of people didn't like the texture but I didn't mind that so much because they were very moist .. more like a cupcake then a muffin. They were just way to bland .. the muffins have the texture of a cupcake without being sweet .... which is just weird. I love pumpkin and yellow cake mix, but together (even with the spices) these muffins just don't have much taste. I would have given these 1 star but the recipe was realy quick and easy and I think with some tweaking the muffins could be better especially with some of the suggestions made by other reviewers ... I think I can salvage the remaining muffins by adding either cream cheese frosting or a glaze, but don't think I'll be making this recipe again.
Made these and loved them. I used freshly grated pumpkin & extra 1/2 tsp nutmeg. Will make them again.
We used a white cake mix, 1 can pumpkin, 1 tsp. of Pumpkin Spice and 1/2 tsp. of Cinnamon. Baked at 350 for 20 minutes in glass 9X12. Just used what we had on hand and it was perfect!
Considering the simplicity of this recipe, it is awesome! I used a spice cake mix instead of measuring in my own spices. I made it with my preschool kiddos, and they loved it!

I just pulled these gorgeous little delights out of the oven. Super easy recipe to make. BE BRAVE and follow the recipe and not be tempted to follow the cake mix directions. These muffins are dense in a "substantial" way, and extremely moist. Amazing! I used fresh sweet potato puree that I had on hand from another recipe. I also left them in the oven for an additional 10 minutes...my choice...not because they needed to cook longer. I prefer the tops to be a bit more golden. I used an Immaculate Baking Company yellow cake mix. I plan to have my nephew try this recipe during one of our baking classes together. Enjoy!!!
I am a new cook , and made these to the T . Super easy even for me , and everyone loved them . Thanks for sharing
The kids make them with chocolate cake mix and chocolate chips
The spices and pumpkin were good. The texture is gluey and nasty. They have no muffin or cake texture.

Really easy and delicious with white chocolate chips added in. The texture is a bit gummy but delicious. 
I had a little extra batter, so I put it in a mug and baked it in the microwave for one minute. It turned out pretty good. I will use the mug idea at work with therapy patients for an easy cooking activity. :-)
I used the spice cake mix cinnamon and nutmeg. I eliminated the cloves. I also sprinkled brown sugar on top to give it a sweet crunch. Very moist and delicious warm.
I made this with sugar free cake mix. They're wonderful! Will definitely make again.
Use a Spice Cake mix and you can leave out cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon
Add half a package of chocolate chips (dark chocolate) to make these truly decadent...
Great . I used pumpkin pie spice sugar and cinnamon instead also frosted them with cream cheese frosting :)

I will start by saying that I am a really good cook but, I CANNOT bake. Everything bake turns out wrong; like some mutant version of what it should have been. Imagine my amazement when I gave this recipe a try and the results were spectacular! I used a carrot cake box mix and added about 1/4 cup of apple sauce. Went over like a dream! I am going to attempt this again with chocolate cake mix and chocolate chips. Being adventurous, I know, but if the results are as good as what I experienced with this recipe I am all in!
Very moist, love it!!!
